node.title: 'It's the best news the town could have asked for': Despair turns to joy for Carnarvon
node.alt: A group of people eat dinner at a table in a pub courtyard at night.
node.description: Searchers head to the local to pub to celebrate after four-year-old Cleo Smith found alive and well.
node.content:
["News of Cleo Smith being found alive spread through the WA town of Carnarvon like wildfire.\u00a0", "Phones were buzzing long before the sun was up, and the celebrations began soon after.", "Among the thousands involved in the initial large-scale search for the four-year-old at the rugged Blowholes Campsite was the local Carnarvon SES crew.", "The volunteers, many of whom know the Smiths\u00a0personally, joined police and military personnel soon after she disappeared.", "Day after gruelling day in the buffeting wind and unforgiving sun the crews trudged through harsh, often near impenetrable coastal scrub \u2014\u00a0thick with spikes and poison prickles.", "But it was nothing compared with the pain of a week of the longest days filled with such searching that found no trace of Cleo Smith.", "", "
SES volunteers were among the first to join the search for Cleo Smith.\u00a0(ABC News: Chris Lewis)
", "Volunteer\u00a0Hamish Brown said he was gutted when the search of the area was eventually called off.", "\"That was pretty tough,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"I remember heading home thinking, this isn't the end.", "", "
Hamish Brown said he had a feeling there would be more news even after the local search was called off.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "Mr Brown said he was left in disbelief when news came through that the little girl had been found alive.", "\"It was just utter relief.\u00a0Phone calls were made to friends, family, and we were all just on the phone to each other ecstatic,\" he said.", "\"It's the best news the town could have asked for.\"", "", "
Cleo Smith was found alone in a Carnarvon house 18 days after being reported missing.\u00a0(Twitter: @WA_Police\u00a0)
", "Mr Brown, who worked with Cleo's mother Ellie Smith at Bankwest for two years, celebrated on Wednesday night with the rest of the Carnarvon SES.", "\"We heard the news and we're all just ecstatic, words can't explain it,\" he said.", "\"It's a get-together for all of us to let our hair down and cheers to Ellie, and Jake, and Cleo, and everyone in Carnarvon.\"", "
Town toasts the good news
", "Management at the Carnarvon Hotel reported they had received a flood of bookings after what had been a \"very quiet\"\u00a0few weeks.", "Sam Gibbings,\u00a0who was there toasting the good news, said everyone around town had a smile on their face.", "\"I woke up this morning and it was just bloody great news to be honest, especially after all the work put in by the police and SES over the last few weeks,\" he said,", "Nicolas Hunt, who was also at the hotel,\u00a0said he was overcome by emotion when he saw the news and the community response and\u00a0could not be more impressed by the police work.", "\"I was a former plain clothes police officer, and I was involved in some similar investigations in the past,\" he said.", "\"Whoever the lead detective was in this case surely deserves a medal, it was just an extraordinary effort, just fantastic, well done.\"", "", "
Carnarvon's SES took an active role in the search for Cleo Smith and were excited to welcome her home.(ABC News: James Carmody)
"]
